Call Congress now to hold DHS accountable by cutting its budget. {include "pre-header-spacing"} {*DO NOT DELETE THE BEACON. THIS IS WHAT ALLOWS ANALYTICS TO BE GATHERED.*} {beacon}

{include "default_salutation"} –

An unprecedented amount of our taxpayer money is being funneled to Homeland Security, the department that carries out so much of Trump's anti-immigrant agenda. DHS is shutting out asylum seekers, separating families, banning immigrants from Muslim-majority countries – the list of abuses goes on.

We have to stop it, {include "first_name"}. Here's how: Call Congress to demand they cut DHS's budget by the Nov. 21 budget deadline. DHS's poor record of abuse speaks for itself.


At the border, we've met Venezuelans fleeing political crisis, and Salvadorans who have witnessed family members gunned down in front of them. Across the world, more people are seeking asylum than ever before. Yet our country is slamming its door shut.

DHS, along with its sub-agencies ICE and CBP, are carrying out the administration's abusive policies against immigrants every day.

ACLU lawyers have filed suit against one anti-immigrant policy after another, but we must also take this fight to Congress and to the streets, and demand that our representatives vote to cut DHS's budget before the Nov. 21 deadline.

There's only one week left, so act now: Call Congress to hold DHS accountable by cutting its budget.

Keep up the fight,

Madhuri Grewal
ACLU Federal Immigration Policy Counsel
